derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a verb in the general sense 'get ready, prepare', specifically 'prepare oneself for battle, gird up'): from dialect fettle 'strip of material, girdle', from Old English fetel, of Germanic origin; related to German Fessel 'chain, band'

entry.def: If you say that someone or something is in fine fettle, you mean that they are in very good health or condition.

means.word_mean: 1. a state of fitness and good health;
